name: ICS Framework
desc:
A series of technical application specifications explored by Idoneus Citadel far beyond what most of the Sector is capable of, promoting results of ship design to an almost artistic level.
- Unconventional sensors adjust the range of all weapons to center around %s units, via shortening non-missile weapon range by %s, before extending by %s.

- Able to initiate an emergency dive deep into p-space before suffering critical damage at the CR cost of its deployment cost, for phase ship only.
- %s of hull and armor damage taken repaired after combat ends at no cost.

name: Stream Repair
desc:
Reduces the time required to repair disabled weapons and engines when in phase by %s.

"Phaser stable, firmware disturbance rate suppressed to negative, maintenance process of vulnerable components has been accelerated."

name: Graviton Deflector
desc:
Deflects oncoming ordnance within %s degrees. Most effective with low flux.
Disabled during venting, phasing, and while ship systems are active.

name: Reverberation Dampeners
desc:
Reduces kinetic damage taken by hull and armor by %s .

Incompatible with most hullmods that affect weapon range.

name: Recall Teleporter
desc: Allows friendly phase ships to teleport to a nearby location. Ships will only teleport if it brings them closer to their designated assignment.

name: Nova Reactor
desc:
A reactor system designed as part of the ICS Framework, which provides energy for the rapidly reconstruction of the ship's armor.
- Reconstructs %s armor per sec in maximum rate, but the rate will be slower as armor integrity increases.

- The actual reconstruct rate is often far below the maximum rate.
- Armor blocks near the nova discharger cannot be reconstructed.

name: Failed Reactor
desc:
The horrible structure of this ship design has resulted in a poorly interfaced configuration with the framework and other subsystems, drastically reducing the effectiveness of its Nova Reactor.
- Reduces the time required to repair disabled weapons and engines by %s, but can not reconstruct armor like a valid nova reactor.

name: Nutrition Resynthesis Annex
desc:
Continuous production of bulk supplies, daily production equivalent to %s of total fleet supply consumption.
Each D-hullmod will reduce the production by %s of total fleet supply consumption, minimum to %s.

The current production is %s of total fleet supply consumption.

name: Phase Bypass
desc:
Alters the hex phaser and related subsystems to focus on maintaining armor integrity.
- Reconstruct %s armor blocks per sec in maximum rate, but the rate will be slower as armor integrity increases.

- The actual reconstruct rate is often far below the maximum rate.
- Armor reconstruction disabled when CR reaches zero.

[Only compatible with ICS phase ships]
short: Bypass phase clock to reconstruct armor

name: Shunt Coating
desc:
Beams hitting on hull or armor will increase ship's flux dissipation by %s of beam's damage.
Beam's EMP per second also contribute to the increase by %s.

[Only compatible with ICS ships]
short: Turns incoming beam damage into flux dissipation

name: Turbulence Valve
desc:
Release a huge amount of sub-space turbulence when the phase coil cools, deals up to %s/%s/%s/%s energy damage to nearby enemy units per second, damage and range decrease linearly with the cooling of the phase coil.
For ships equipped with Progressive Phase, the effect can be triggered only after the time-flow rate reaches %s.

[Only compatible with ICS phase ships]

name: Munitions AutoFac
desc:
Minor autofactory, increases ammo regen rate of all weapons that auto-regen ammo. The increase is positively correlated with the ratio of max ammo to weapon's OP cost.
- Relieves %s cooldown burden for MX drones that replenishing ship's ammunition.

[Only compatible with ICS ships]

name: Tactical Ansible
desc:
The fewer/smaller friendly ship units and more/larger enemy ship units within {%s/%s/%s/%s} range, the more damage dealt to targets with the same or smaller hullsize as self.
- Damage increases up to %s.

[Only compatible with ICS ships]
